>So said gdinwiddie on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>--- In junit@yahoog=
roups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
>> I like keeping test=
 classes separate from production classes, so
>that I don't have to rely on=
 a naming convention.
>
>Yeah, me too.  Eclipse has encouraged me to do thi=
s.

I use different projects for tests. That's not CVS-friendly, but Subver=
sion supports versioning multiple modules at once.

>> You might try GSBase=
's RecursiveTestSuite which allows you to scan
>the file system for tests, =
then use a TestFilter to choose the ones
>you want to execute. This is not =
an Ant-based solution.
>
>Thanks, J.B.  I'll have to think about whether or=
 not it's worth
>hooking this into the ant build.  In the mean time, I've s=
et it up
>using a naming convention ("**/*Test.class") in my test class tre=
e,
>but that raises the possibility of missing a test due to a naming error=
.

That's pretty rare. I wouldn't lose sleep over it.
